page.title: 01GEOGRAPHY OF THE AREA
page.content: Ireby village is situated in the valley of the river Ellen some 7 miles south of Wigton, 11 miles north-east of Cockermouth and 11 miles north of Keswick. The surrounding country is hilly, but is mostly farmland rather than high fell.In addition to many isolated farmhouses, there are a number of small villages or hamlets around Ireby: Boltongate to the north,Sandale to the north-west,Aughertree to the east,Uldale to the south-east, Ruthwaite to the south, High Ireby to the south-west and Whitrigg and Torpenhow to the west. Ireby was an important market and fair town in times past and although it has declined in this context, it remains an important village being one of the highest in population in the district.
